question: Which of the following kings was not a part of the anti-Arab Rajput confederacy that repelled attacks of Arab armies under Junaid in
explanation: The swarm of Arabs had attacked several places in India around 723-726 A.D under Junaid and other commanders such as Al Hakim. These forces were confronted in India by forces of Gurjara Pratihara king Nagabhata-I who combined his army with Jaysimha Varman of the Rashtrakuta Empire and Rajput forces under Bappa Rawal, at the border of Rajasthan. Junaid as well as Hakim were killed by Indian forces.
